intro: Kefersteinia sanguinolenta, commonly known as the red blood plant, is a striking member of the Aizoaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant red to orange flowers that bloom in spring. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and arid landscapes. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often cultivated in controlled environments to ensure its survival.
